data.title: local.properties requires '/'s
data.body: Intellij garbles the path with backslashes, this fixes this problem for Windows where the path of the sdk from the textfield is returned with backslashes.

data.title: GWT - ClassReflection#getSimpleName returns fully-qualified name
data.body:
The GWT implementation of ClassReflection#getSimpleName returns a fully-qualified name (com.foo.Bar), where as the 'java' implementation returns just the class name (Bar), as one would expect.

Affects 0.9.9 and 1,0-SNAPSHOT as of Monday 24th March.

data.title: Sets up the local.properties (Useful for intellij users)
data.body:
If a user does not have an ANDROID_HOME environment variable set up, Intellij will fail the gradle project refresh.

Defining the sdk location in local.properties bypasses having to set up the ANDROID_HOME, one less hurdle to jump for those not too comfortable on the CLI.

data.title: Gradle gwt:dist task not working correctly
data.body: gwtCompile is executed asynchronously, so packaging happens before compile is done.

data.title: Mods3d
data.body:
Functions to draw xyz model and grid plane model
Function to set a Renderable on a Renderable

data.title: FixedScaleViewport
data.body:
With the new Viewport classes that were added recently, there isn't a viewport type to support fixed 'pixels per world unit' type rendering. This pull request contains a new FixedScaleViewport than can be instantiated with just a scaling factor. The world width and height will simply be scaled from the screen dimensions, by the specified scaling factor. If the screen is resized, the world dimensions will change proportionally. So, for example, a game that relies on the fact that 32 pixels represent 1 world unit, could use a FixedScaleViewport(1/32).

This patch also adds the new viewport to the relevant tests.

data.title: Cosmetic: override in place of switch/case.
data.body: This change doesn't add and doesn't break anything, but it's cleaner and makes use of the power of Java enums :)

data.title: Gradle, gdx-setup.jar. Only cli works on my end.
data.body:
Gradle is just so welcome! Great work, guys.
Following the instructions I can run from the command line.
However, when importing to Eclipse, this error arises on the actual import:
"Multiple problems:
Invalid project description.
Project-name (TestGame-core) should match last segment of location (/Path/Projects/TestGame/core) [...]"
with every sub project in the default setup.
Tried setting different values in the build.gradle files of the projects and sub projects setting "name = appName + "-android"" to "name = "android"", but with other errors arising. No luck, in other words.

Decided to try in IntelliJ as well. Importing is a breeze. When it's imported it seems like IntelliJ is oblivious of the Gdx framework (Package Gdx does not exist). Well, no luck here either in other words.

Anything obvious I'm missing here?

data.title: CheckBoxStyle with padding between image and label
data.body:
**Problem**
Whenever (read always) I wanted to pad the area between images and text in checkboxes I had to call checkbox.getLabelCell().padLeft(someValue); for all checkboxes. This was a bit cumbersome as I had to remember to call this method for all checkboxes.

**Possible solution**
I've created a solution which adds a new optional padding variable to the CheckBoxStyle. This variable determines the padding between the image and the label.

**Possible future enhancement**
Create a method setPadBetween(float) or padBetween(float) to override the style's padding for single checkboxes.

**Testing**
I've tested this implementation and I'm currently using it in my game :)

data.title: knobBefore properly drawn
data.body: Fixes an issue with knobBefore when there's no knob (typical progress bar)

data.title: ios multitouch problem
Update todos.txt
data.body: GL1X bindings no longer included in libgdx...

data.title: Unreasonable random framerate drops / slowdowns
data.body:
I have a very simple game that I recently ported over to libgdx (I haven't used libgdx before), and I've been experiencing random framerate drops that occour pretty frequently and consistently. The game was running perfectly on the previous engine, so I decided to do a test. I created a new libgdx project and then added a few lines of code to display the framerate on the screen, and ran the test on my phone. And I get the exact same framerate drops, even though there's nothing else happening in the code other than the default welcome screen being drawn.

I checked the logcat for garbage collection massages, but it doesn't seem to be causing the problem. I also tried installing previous versions of libgdx, but that didn't work either. Also, my problem has a strong resemblance with this post on the forums: http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=21&t=11362&p=51083&hilit=framerate+drop#p51083

It's very strange, because I downloaded some libgdx games from the Google Play Store and I didn't have any problems with them. I have a Sony Xperia L, and I'm running Android 4.1.2.

data.title: Natives: Patched SharedLibraryLoader for BlackBerry support
data.body: SharedLibraryLoader failed to load natives do to being unable to load natives for BlackBerry this patch allows the BlackBerry OS to be recongized and load the Android natives since BlackBerry contains an Android environment and newer versions of the OS actually run Android

data.title: Add mulLeft() to matrix math classes
data.body: Quaternion has it, matrix classes should also have mulLeft, It would be very userful.

data.title: Update ImmediateModeRenderer.java
data.body: Allows setting of ShapeRenderer's shader through shapeRenderer.getRenderer().setShader(shaderProgram);

data.title: Update FirstPersonCameraController.java
data.body: IntMap replaced with bit flags and valid input returns, if no flag found returns false on keyUp and keyDown

data.title: Small optimization to avoid unnecessary square roots
iOS: Force linked OpenSL classes
data.body: Fixes #866

data.title: Gradle: Enforced OpenGL ES 2.0 requirement on iOS
data.body:
Apple developer guidelines recommend putting this in the Info.plist
This also prevents libGDX from running on devices without OpenGL ES 2.0 support

data.title: Enforced minimum SDK version on Android
data.body: This prevents devs that don't update their AndroidManifest.xml from having their games explode with a random exception.

data.title: Simplify Intersector#intersectRaySphere
data.body: This projects the center of the sphere onto the ray (=the point on the ray closest to the center of the sphere). If the distance between this point on the ray and the center of the sphere is less than the radius, then there's an intersection. This also removes the tmp usage.

data.title: Simplify loop conditionals for while loops in JsonReader and XmlReader.
Suggestion: OpenAL audio backend for Android
data.body:
It seems that there is a bug in SoundPool, as described here:
http://www.thiagorosa.com.br/how-to/improve-soundpool-performance
I'm playing 1s sound and it takes 3-8ms normally (which is very long) and sometimes it takes even 100ms. I didn't find any solution for this. I tried sound.loop(0) as described in linked article but it did not work. So I'm suggesting to add OpenAL backend for Android audio.

data.title: Remove obsolete method checkGLES1Validity from VertexAttributes.
iOS backend orientation
data.body:
While the iOS backend is still using it, it seems ShouldAutorotateToInterfaceOrientation has been deprecated since iOS 6. GetSupportedInterfaceOrientations should be used instead, refer to the very end at http://docs.xamarin.com/guides/ios/platform_features/introduction_to_ios_6/

Also, it would be a nice to have method to set the orientation through LibGDX, or at least be able to change the orientationLandscape / orientationPortrait properties in the config so we can change the orientation that way.

data.title: Changed RoboVM version to 0.0.10.
data.body: Changed RoboVM version 0.0.9 to 0.0.10.

data.body: Changed RoboVM version 0.0.9 to 0.0.10.
